Here rests from song and bacchanalian mirth,</br>A wag, to music, glee, and song well known,</br>Apollo frown'd not on his humble birth,</br>And rosy Bacchus mark'd him for his own.
True to that god, sincere as to his lass,</br>The god an ample recompense did send;—</br>He gave the minstrel all he had — a glass;</br>'Twas all he wish'd — 'twas dearer than a friend.

But of his failings here no more disclose,</br>He had his virtues, let them step between,</br>And say, "Poor Charley!  sleep in soft repose,</br>'Till Nature's God shall change the gloomy scene."</br>
